DOC.brief_summary: The study hypothesis was that epidural fentanyl may accelerate the dilation of the cervix and possibly result in a shorter duration of vaginal delivery.
DOC.brief_title: the Effects of Epidural Fentanyl on Vaginal Delivery
DOC.criteria: American Society of Anaesthesiologists physical status I or II nulliparous normal singleton uncomplicated pregnancies of more than 38 weeks cephalic presentation of the fetus anticipated vaginal delivery active stage of labour cervical dilatation between 35 cm regular uterine contractions normal cardiotocographic recordings. medical problems during pregnancy BMI≥40 kg m−2 opioid allergy prior administration of opioids or other analgesics
